news.title: Home Office admits facial recognition tech issue with black and Asian subjects
news.summary: Home Office admits technology more likely to incorrectly identify black and Asian people than their white counterparts. Calls for review after technology found to return more false positives for ‘some demographic groups’ on certain settings.

news.title: Cloudflare apologises after latest outage takes down LinkedIn and Zoom
news.summary: Web infrastructure provider says problem lasted half an hour and was not an attack, weeks after larger outage. “Any outage of our systems is unacceptable, and we know we have let the internet down again,” it said.

news.title: ‘It was about degrading someone completely’: the story of Mr DeepFakes – the world’s most notorious AI porn site
news.summary: German journalist Patrizia Schlosser found fake images of herself online. She was naked, squatting, chained, performing sex acts with various animals. “They were very graphic, very humiliating,” she says.

news.title: I spent hours listening to Sabrina Carpenter this year. So why do I have a Spotify ‘listening age’ of 86?
news.summary: For the first time, Spotify is calculating the ‘listening age’ of all its users. Many users of the app were shocked, this week, by this addition to the Spotify Wrapped roundup.

news.title: Elon Musk’s X fined €120m by EU in first clash under new digital laws
news.summary: Elon Musk’s social media platform, X, has been fined €120m (£105m) It was found in breach of new EU digital laws. Ruling likely to put European Commission on collision course with billionaire, and possibly Donald Trump.

news.title: Tesla launches cheaper version of Model 3 in Europe amid Musk sales backlash
news.summary: CEO Elon Musk says lower-cost electric car will reignite demand by appealing to broader range of buyers. Tesla has launched the lower-priced version of its Model 3 car.

news.title: Explaining UK debt with biscuits: Labour MPs get the hang of viral content
news.summary: Gordon McKee, who represents Glasgow South, has racked up more than 3.3m views on X. His 101-second video demonstrates the UK’s debt to GDP ratio using stacks of custard creams and chocolate bourbons.

news.title: Horror game Horses has been banned from sale – but is it as controversial as you’d think?
news.summary: Steam and Epic Games Store pulled Horses before its 2 December launch date. The game was also briefly removed from the Humble Store, but was reinstated a day later. The controversy has helped the game rocket to the top of the digital stores that are selling it.
